statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Justin Rutty scored 26 points and pulled down 10 rebounds to lead Quinnipiac to an 82-81 victory over Boston University on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Justin Rutty's double-double lets Quinnipiac eke by BU
article.linkText: Rutty's double-double lets Quinnipiac eke by BU
article.story: BOSTON -- Justin Rutty scored 26 points and pulled down 10 rebounds to lead Quinnipiac to an 82-81 victory over Boston University on Wednesday night. The Bobcats (9-2) trailed 81-80 before a tip-in from Dominique Langston with 3 seconds left sealed the win for Quinnipiac. John Holland's 3-point attempt rimmed out at the buzzer as the Terriers (5-8) lost for the fifth time in their last six contests. Holland finished with 31 points and nine rebounds to lead Boston U., while Jake O'Brien scored 18, D.J. Irving 14 and Darryl Partin 10 in the loss. Quinnipiac, which leads the nation in rebounds per game (45.2), pulled down 46 rebounds and outscored the Terriers 44-28 in the paint. Lance Brown scored 13 points, Langston had 12 and James Johnson 11 for the Bobcats, who have won five straight. The second half featured eight ties and seven lead changes as both teams led by at least five.
